channel.title: Comments on: Character encoding in an Ajax LotusScript agent

item.title: By: Matt White
item.dc:creator: Matt White
item.description: <p>@2 - Absolutely correct, that wa sa typo on my part which I have now corrected.<br /><br />Thanks<br /><br />Matt</p>
item.content:encoded:
@2 – Absolutely correct, that wa sa typo on my part which I have now corrected.

Thanks

Matt

item.title: By: Tommy Valand
item.dc:creator: Tommy Valand
item.description: <p>According to W3C it should be:<br/><br />print |content-type: text/plain; charset=utf-8|<br/><br /><br/><br />W3C - HTTP Charset: { <a href="<a rel="nofollow" href="http://www.w3.org/International/O-HTTP-charset"" rel="nofollow ugc">http://www.w3.org/International/O-HTTP-charset"</a> rel="nofollow" target ="blank">Link</a> }<br/><br /><br/><br />Although a colon may work in most browsers, I'd recommend sticking to W3C's recommendations.</p>
item.content:encoded:
According to W3C it should be:

print |content-type: text/plain; charset=utf-8|

W3C – HTTP Charset: { http://www.w3.org/International/O-HTTP-charset“ rel=”nofollow” target =”blank”>Link }

Although a colon may work in most browsers, I’d recommend sticking to W3C’s recommendations.
